channel.description: Temperature at the location. Daily values are average values (mean) for the day.

channel.label: Minimum Temperature
channel.description: Minimum temperature at the location.

channel.label: Maximum Temperature
channel.description: Maximum temperature at the location.

channel.label: Feels Like
channel.description: What the temperature feels like accounting for heat index or wind chill. Daily values are average values (mean) for the day.

channel.label: Feels Like (min)
channel.description: Minimum feels like temperature at the location.

channel.label: Feels Like (max)
channel.description: Maximum feels like temperature at the location.

channel.label: Dew
channel.description: Dew point temperature

channel.label: Snow Depth
channel.description: The depth of snow on the ground

channel.label: Wind Gust
channel.description: Instantaneous wind speed at a location – May be empty if it is not significantly higher than the wind speed. Daily values are the maximum hourly value for the day.
The sustained wind speed measured as the average windspeed that occurs during the preceding one to two minutes. Daily values are the maximum hourly value for the day.
Direction from which the wind is blowing
The sea level atmospheric or barometric pressure in millibars (or hectopascals)

A value between 0 and 10 indicating the level of ultra violet (UV) exposure for that hour or day. 10 represents high level of exposure, and 0 represents no exposure. The UV index is calculated based on amount of short wave solar radiation which in turn is a level the cloudiness, type of cloud, time of day, time of year and location altitude. Daily values represent the maximum value of the hourly values.

channel.label: Sunrise Epoch
channel.description: Sunrise time specified as number of seconds since 1st January 1970 in UTC time

channel.label: Sunset Epoch
channel.description: Sunset time specified as number of seconds since 1st January 1970 in UTC time
Temperature at the location. Daily values are average values (mean) for the day.

channel.label: Sunrise Epoch
channel.description: Sunrise time specified as number of seconds since 1st January 1970 in UTC time

channel.label: Sunset Epoch
channel.description: Sunset time specified as number of seconds since 1st January 1970 in UTC time

channel-type.label: Current Cost
channel-type.description: How much API tokens thing used since start

channel-type.label: Description
channel-type.description: Longer text descriptions suitable for displaying in weather displays. The descriptions combine the main features of the weather for the day such as precipitation or amount of cloud cover. Daily descriptions are provided for historical and forecast days. When the timeline request includes the model forecast period, a seven day outlook description is provided at the root response level.

channel-type.label: Time
channel-type.description: In format HH:mm:ss

channel-type.label: Precip
channel-type.description: The amount of liquid precipitation that fell or is predicted to fall in the period. This includes the liquid-equivalent amount of any frozen precipitation such as snow or ice.

channel-type.label: Precip Prob
channel-type.description: The likelihood of measurable precipitation ranging from 0% to 100%

channel-type.label: Precip Type
channel-type.description: An comma separated array indicating the type(s) of precipitation expected or that occurred. Possible values include `rain`, `snow`, `freezingrain` and `ice`.

channel-type.label: Precip Cover
channel-type.description: The proportion of hours where there was non-zero precipitation

channel-type.label: Snow
channel-type.description: The amount of snow that fell or is predicted to fall

channel-type.label: Visibility
channel-type.description: Distance at which distant objects are visible

channel-type.label: Cloud Cover
channel-type.description: How much of the sky is covered in cloud ranging from 0–100%

channel-type.label: Solar Radiation
channel-type.description: The solar radiation power at the instantaneous moment of the observation (or forecast prediction). See the full solar radiation data documentation (https://www.visualcrossing.com/resources/documentation/weather-data/how-to-obtain-solar-radiation-data/) and Wind and Solar Energy (https://www.visualcrossing.com/resources/documentation/weather-api/energy-elements-in-the-timeline-weather-api/) pages.

channel-type.label: Solar Energy
channel-type.description: (MJ /m^2) Indicates the total energy from the sun that builds up over an hour or day. See the full solar radiation data documentation (https://www.visualcrossing.com/resources/documentation/weather-data/how-to-obtain-solar-radiation-data/) and Wind and Solar Energy (https://www.visualcrossing.com/resources/documentation/weather-api/energy-elements-in-the-timeline-weather-api/) pages.

channel-type.label: Conditions
channel-type.description: Textual representation of the weather conditions. See Weather Data Conditions (https://www.visualcrossing.com/resources/documentation/weather-api/weather-condition-fields/).

channel-type.label: Icon
channel-type.description: A fixed, machine readable summary that can be used to display an icon

channel-type.label: Stations
channel-type.description: The weather stations (comma separated) used when collecting an historical observation record

channel-type.label: Source
channel-type.description: The type of weather data used for this weather object. – Values include historical observation (“obs”), forecast (“fcst”), historical forecast (“histfcst”) or statistical forecast (“stats”). If multiple types are used in the same day, “comb” is used. Today a combination of historical observations and forecast data.

channel-type.label: Sunrise
channel-type.description: The formatted time of the sunrise (For example “2022-05-23T05:50:40”). See How to include sunrise, sunset, moon phase, moonrise and moonset data into your API requests (https://www.visualcrossing.com/resources/documentation/weather-api/how-to-include-sunrise-sunset-and-moon-phase-data-into-your-api-requests/)

channel-type.label: Sunset
channel-type.description: The formatted time of the sunset (For example “2022-05-23T20:22:29”).

channel-type.label: Moon Phase
channel-type.description: Represents the fractional portion through the current moon lunation cycle ranging from 0 (the new moon) to 0.5 (the full moon) and back to 1 (the next new moon).

channel-type.label: Severe Risk
channel-type.description: A value between 0 and 100 representing the risk of convective storms (e.g. thunderstorms, hail and tornadoes). Severe risk is a scaled measure that combines a variety of other fields such as the convective availabel potential energy (CAPE) and convective inhibition (CIN), predicted rain and wind. Typically, a severe risk value less than 30 indicates a low risk, between 30 and 70 a moderate risk and above 70 a high risk.
